procedure: Arthroscopic femoroplasty with labral repair, right hip
extraction_data.summary: 32-year-old female with cam-type femoroacetabular impingement and labral tear of the right hip who failed conservative management. Patient underwent arthroscopic femoroplasty with labral repair and capsular closure of the right hip. Three knotless suture anchors were utilized during the procedure, with the patient placed in a hip brace postoperatively with flat-foot weight-bearing restrictions.

documentation: Function-limiting pain (Evidence: pg no: 10, L410-L412)

exclusions: Any other indication or condition (Evidence: pg no: 10, L439-L440)

Other potential diagnostic conditions including fracture, thoracic outlet syndrome, brachial plexus disorders, referred neck pain, cervical radiculopathy, and advanced glenohumeral osteoarthritis have been excluded (Evidence: pg no: 12, L504-L507)

exclusions: Any other indication or condition (Evidence: pg no: 12, L509-L510)

full_source.section_title: Primary Total Hip Arthroplasty (Evidence: pg no: 24, L835)
names: Primary Total Hip Arthroplasty (Evidence: pg no: 24, L835)

full_source.description: Total hip arthroplasty (THA), also referred to as total hip replacement (THR), involves removal of the femoral head and acetabulum and placement of a prosthesis anchored to the bone. The goal of the procedure is long-term pain relief and restoration of function. (Evidence: pg no: 22, L746-L749)
full_source.scope: This guideline addresses hip arthroplasty when performed as an elective, non-emergent procedure and not as part of the care of an acute fracture (excluding fracture of implant and periprosthetic fracture). (Evidence: pg no: 22, L756-L757)

documentation: Primary and secondary tumors of the proximal femur (Evidence: pg no: 24, L837)
Hip fracture or complications including malunion, nonunion or failed prior fixation (Evidence: pg no: 24, L838)
Failed previous hip fracture fixation (Evidence: pg no: 24, L839)
Avascular necrosis (osteonecrosis) with unresponsive severe pain (Evidence: pg no: 24, L840)
Revision of hip arthrodesis (Evidence: pg no: 24, L841)
Imaging evidence of significant joint destruction and cartilage loss, defined as Tnnis grade 3, modified Outerbridge grade III  IV, or Kellgren-Lawrence grade 3  4 (Evidence: pg no: 24, L844-L845)
Limited range of motion, antalgic gait and disabling pain of at least 3 months' duration (Evidence: pg no: 24, L846)
Pain with passive motion of the hip (Evidence: pg no: 24, L847)
Failure of at least 3 months of non-surgical conservative management (Evidence: pg no: 24, L848-L849)
Functional limitation secondary to hip pathology which interferes with the ability to perform age-appropriate daily activities (Evidence: pg no: 24, L850-L851)

exclusions: Indications for total hip arthroplasty other than those addressed in this guideline are considered not medically necessary (Evidence: pg no: 26, L937-L938)

codes.description: Arthroplasty, acetabular and proximal femoral prosthetic replacement (total hip arthroplasty), with or without autograft or allograft (Evidence: pg no: 27, L973-L974)

full_source.notes: All arthroplasty and acetabuloplasty/resection arthroplasty procedures are inclusive of synovectomy, removal of osteophytes, removal of loose bodies, manipulation of the hip, and release or repair of structures to gain entrance to the hip joint. (Evidence: pg no: 22, L749-L751)

procedure_results.policy_name: Anthem Clinical UM Guideline - Hip Arthroscopy
primary_reasons: Documentation does not establish moderate to severe hip pain interfering with ADLs
No documentation of positive impingement sign on clinical examination
No documentation of failure of 3 months of conservative management

requirement_checklist.missing_to_meet: Documentation of moderate to severe hip pain that interferes with activities of daily living
requirement_checklist.suggestion: Document severity of hip pain and specific impact on activities of daily living

requirement_checklist.missing_to_meet: Documentation of positive impingement sign on clinical examination
requirement_checklist.suggestion: Document results of impingement testing (pain with 90 degrees flexion and internal rotation/adduction)
Include MRI findings that confirm the labral tear diagnosis

requirement_checklist.missing_to_meet: Documentation of failure of at least 3 months of non-surgical conservative management
requirement_checklist.suggestion: Document specific conservative treatments attempted, duration, and failure to improve

requirement_checklist.missing_to_meet: Documentation of functional limitations secondary to hip pathology
requirement_checklist.suggestion: Document specific functional limitations caused by hip condition

coding_implications.notes: CPT 29914 would be appropriate for femoroplasty component if medical necessity criteria are met

documentation_gaps: Severity of hip pain and impact on ADLs
Physical examination findings including impingement testing
Duration and types of conservative management attempted
compliance_actions: Document comprehensive physical examination with impingement testing
Specify duration and types of conservative management with outcomes
Quantify pain severity and functional limitations

documentation: Primary and secondary tumors of the proximal femur (Evidence: pg no: 24, L837)
Hip fracture or complications including malunion, nonunion or failed prior fixation (Evidence: pg no: 24, L838)
Failed previous hip fracture fixation (Evidence: pg no: 24, L839)
Avascular necrosis (osteonecrosis) with unresponsive severe pain (Evidence: pg no: 24, L840)
Revision of hip arthrodesis (Evidence: pg no: 24, L841)
Imaging evidence of significant joint destruction and cartilage loss, defined as Tnnis grade 3, modified Outerbridge grade III  IV, or Kellgren-Lawrence grade 3  4 (Evidence: pg no: 24, L844-L845)
Limited range of motion, antalgic gait and disabling pain of at least 3 months' duration (Evidence: pg no: 24, L846)
Pain with passive motion of the hip (Evidence: pg no: 24, L847)
Failure of at least 3 months of non-surgical conservative management (Evidence: pg no: 24, L848-L849)

exclusions: Indications for total hip arthroplasty other than those addressed in this guideline are considered not medically necessary (Evidence: pg no: 26, L937-L938)

codes.description: Arthroplasty, acetabular and proximal femoral prosthetic replacement (total hip arthroplasty), with or without autograft or allograft (Evidence: pg no: 27, L973-L974)

original_chart:
OPERATIVE REPORT

Patient Name: Emily Rogers
MRN: 908712345
Date of Service: July 15, 2025
Surgeon: Dr. Samuel Lee, MD

PROCEDURES PERFORMED:
1. Arthroscopic femoroplasty with labral repair, right hip
2. Capsular closure, right hip

INDICATIONS:
32-year-old female with femoroacetabular impingement and labral tear unresponsive to activity modification and injections.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS:
1. Cam-type femoroacetabular impingement, right hip
2. Labral tear, right hip

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS:
Same as above.

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL:
The patient was positioned supine on the traction table. Fluoroscopy confirmed access. Diagnostic arthroscopy revealed labral tearing from 1 to 3 o'clock with acetabular chondrosis. Labrum was mobilized, debrided to stable tissue, and secured with suture anchors to restore the seal. Femoral head-neck junction was contoured using burr to address cam lesion. Capsular closure performed with simple sutures.

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS: 75 mL (approximate).
COMPLICATIONS: None.
DRAINS: None.
TRACTION TIME: Not recorded.

IMPLANTS:
Three knotless suture anchors utilized.

POSTOPERATIVE PLAN:
Patient placed on hip brace with flat-foot weight-bearing. Physical therapy to begin at two weeks with emphasis on range of motion. Return to sport timeline not specified.

user_input_required.suggestion: Document specific activities that are limited or prevented by hip condition (e.g., walking distance, sitting tolerance, athletic activities)

user_input_required.reason: All payers require documentation of at least 3 months of conservative management
user_input_required.suggestion: Specify exact duration (in months) of conservative management prior to surgical intervention

user_input_required.reason: Documentation of specific non-surgical treatments attempted is required
user_input_required.suggestion: List all conservative treatments attempted (e.g., physical therapy, NSAIDs, activity modification, injections) with duration and outcomes

user_input_required.reason: Positive impingement sign is required by Anthem for medical necessity determination
user_input_required.suggestion: Document results of specific impingement tests (e.g., FADIR test, FABER test) and other relevant physical examination findings

user_input_required.reason: Documentation of advanced imaging confirming labral tear is required by all payers
user_input_required.suggestion: Include specific MRI findings including date of study, location and characteristics of labral tear, and other relevant findings

user_input_required.reason: Documentation of traction time is important for quality reporting and safety monitoring
user_input_required.suggestion: Document total traction time in minutes

user_input_required.reason: Comprehensive documentation of intraoperative findings supports medical necessity
user_input_required.suggestion: Document status of articular cartilage, ligamentum teres, and any other intra-articular pathology identified

recommendations.recommendation: Document specific conservative treatments attempted for at least 3 months with outcomes
Document specific functional limitations caused by hip condition that impact activities of daily living
Document comprehensive hip examination including positive impingement testing
Include specific MRI findings confirming labral tear with date of study
Document pain severity and impact on activities of daily living
Document traction time and detailed arthroscopic findings

compliance_impact.before: Original documentation lacked required elements for medical necessity determination including conservative management details, functional limitations, physical examination findings, and diagnostic imaging confirmation. These gaps would likely result in claim denial from all payers.
compliance_impact.after: With improvements and physician input, documentation will meet medical necessity criteria for hip arthroscopy by establishing appropriate conservative management duration, functional limitations, positive physical examination findings, and confirmatory imaging. The improved documentation supports the medical necessity of both procedures performed.
key_changes: Added structured documentation of conservative management with duration and outcomes
Added documentation of functional limitations and pain severity
Added physical examination section with impingement testing
Added diagnostic imaging section for MRI confirmation of labral tear
Enhanced procedure details with specific intraoperative findings
Improved overall organization with clear section headers
